entries.meaning: In a buccal manner, such as:
(dentistry, medicine, referring to force, movement, or both) In the buccal direction; toward the cheek.
examples: 2010,  Staley, Robert N.; Reske, Neil T.,  Essentials of Orthodontics: Diagnosis and Treatment‎[1], →ISBN, page 86:Banded molars can be rotated, moved buccally and lingually, extruded on one side, and intruded on the other side in ways that are not desired.

entries.meaning: (dentistry, medicine) Via buccal administration; via absorption through the mucosa of the cheek.
